Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_3D_sample_file

The function AIL_set_3D_sample_file sets the sample starting address, type, and playback rate from the input file image.

S32 AIL_set_3D_sample_file(
  H3DSAMPLE S,
  void const * file_image
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample handle whose address and length are to be set.
file_image
points to an uncompressed WAV file image.

Returns

Non-zero if the file is successfully loaded, zero if the image could not be deciphered.

Discussion

The input file image must be a Microsoft mono, uncompressed PCM WAV file.

This function only takes uncompressed WAV files, so you must use AIL_decompress_ADPCM or AIL_decompress_ASI to decompress the data before calling this function. This function also only takes mono data, so you must use AIL_process_digital_audio to convert stereo files, if necessary.

Example files that use this function: EXAM3D.C


Group: 3D Digital Audio Services
